summary: This is an FBI Collected Item Log documenting the seizure of a DVR system (DVR System #2) from the Metropolitan Corrections Center (MCC) in New York on August 14, 2019. The seizure was part of the death investigation of Jeffrey Epstein, who was found deceased in his cell at the MCC.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Listed as the subject of a death investigation. The seizure of the DVR system from the MCC where he died is documented in relation to this investigation.

persons.name: Hughwon Daniel
persons.context: Identified as the electronics technician at the Metropolitan Corrections Center from whom the DVR system was collected.

connections.description: Hughwon Daniel was an electronics technician at the correctional facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held and died. The FBI collected a DVR system from Daniel as part of the investigation into Epstein's death.

events.title: Seizure of DVR System from MCC
events.description: A Task Force Officer (TFO) from the NYPD seized 'DVR System #2', a NICE VISION PRO Digital Video & Audio Recorder, from the Metropolitan Corrections Center in New York.

events.title: FBI Logs Seizure
events.description: The FBI documented the seizure of the DVR system in a Collected Item Log, formally recording it as part of the Jeffrey Epstein death investigation.

locations: Metropolitan Corrections Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York
keyFacts: The FBI seized a digital video and audio recording system (DVR System #2) from the Metropolitan Corrections Center (MCC) on August 14, 2019.
The seizure was part of the death investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, who died while in custody at the MCC.
The DVR system was collected from MCC electronics technician Hughwon Daniel.
The document is an official FBI Collected Item Log, indicating the seizure was part of a formal investigative process.
The specific model and serial numbers of the seized DVR components (Disk Array Chassis and Controller) are recorded in the log.
